physical_appearance: This painting depicts the natural historian Claës Fredrik Hornstedt, alongside with his slave who is named as Ali, examing several animal specimens behind a table. The background of the painting comprises of trees and the sky. The painting has a wooden frame and a pink border. Hornsted's skin is painted as pale whereas Ali's skin is painted as dark brown. Hornsted is also dressed totally in a white colonial outfit while Ali only adorns a pair of brown shorts and is barefoot. There is a crocodile and a monkey standing on the ground alongside Hornstedt and Ali. There is one dead bird on the table and another in a transparent jar.Ali is holding an animal in his hands and Hornstedt is looking at it.
sgcool_label_text: "This watercolour depicts the Swedish naturalist Claës Fredrik Hornstedt examining natural history specimens. The setting for this scene is Java, where Hornstedt spent a year between 1783 and 1784, supported by the Batavian Society of Arts and Science. He is attended to by a slave named Ali, as indicated in the accompanying inscription, Ali being a name he gave to his slave in replacement of his ""long Javanese name"". The inscription is dated 1788
title_text: Claës Fredrik Hornstedt examining natural history specimens, attended by his slave Ali, in Java
